column1: Table 49: Medical treatment of ischaemic priapism

column2:
• 
Intracavernous injection of 200 μg every 3-5 minutes.
• 
Maximum dosage is 1 mg within 1 hour.
• 
Lower doses are recommended in children and patients with severe 
cardiovascular diseases.

• 
Intracavernosal injection at a concentration of 2.5 mg in 1-2 mL normal 
saline.

• 
Intracavernous injection of 50-100 mg, left for 5 minutes. It is then aspirated 
and the penis compressed for an additional 5 minutes.
